text.section: In this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Application" means an application to the Rural Legacy Board to designate a Rural Legacy Area.
"BPW" means the Maryland State Board of Public Works.
"Grant agreement" means an agreement between the Board and a sponsor to implement a Rural Legacy Plan in a designated Rural Legacy Area.

"Land trust" means a qualified conservation organization that:
Is a qualified organization under § 170(h)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code and regulations adopted under § 170(h)(3); and
Has executed a cooperative agreement with the Maryland Environmental Trust.
"Priority funding area" means an area designated as a priority funding area under § 5-7B-02 of the State Finance and Procurement Article.
"Program" means the Rural Legacy Program established by this subtitle.
"Rural Legacy Area" means a region within or outside a metropolitan area designated by the Board as rich in a multiple of agricultural, forestry, natural, and cultural resources.
"Rural Legacy Plan" means a plan accepted by the Board for acquisition of easements and fee interests in Rural Legacy Areas.
"Sponsor" means a local government, group of local governments, or a land trust.
